newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares trade buoyant, index dips.
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares trade buoyant, index dips.

text.p: Trade on the Latvian stock exchange was buoyant on Friday although several stocks took a tumble, leading to a fall in bank indices tracking the market.
Turnover came to 275,000 lats versus 168,000 lats but the Rietumu Bank index of 16 most active shares slipped 0.29 percent to 184.76. Saules Bank's Saule10 fell 0.31 percent to 187.48.

The biggest faller was the newest stock on the bourse, Valmiera Glassfibre, which tumbled nearly 15 percent to 1.95 lats. The share has run out of steam since soaring above its nominal one lat price after it was launched on the bourse on Monday. It showed turnover of 71,200 lats.

Leading blue chip Unibanka, expected to release its 1996 audited results on Monday, was stable at 4.46 lats, also stalling a bull run that took it higher at the start of the week. It showed the highest market trade of 94,100 lats.
Fellow official list stock Staburadze fell to 2.81 lats from 2.94 lats on turnover of just 3,400 lats.
Riga Transport Fleet failed to move, sticking at 1.70 lats on turnover of 4,100 lats.
Daugavpils Chain was another stock on the secondary list that saw buoyant business, turning over 60,300 lats of shares as it gained slightly to 2.75 lats from 2.70 lats.
Shares worth 16,00 lats were traded in Lode Brick, which crept one santime higher to 2.15 lats.
